meaning: in a way that is based on chance rather than being planned or based on reason
the same; not changing or different in any way
to make something else seem better or more attractive when combining with it
more noticeable or important, or larger in number, than others
to reduce something to the least possible level or amount
a collection of objects that is shown to the public in a museum, etc.
left in a particular place or condition, usually forever
to cause something to happen
to represent something
to look at or consider again an idea, piece of writing, etc., in order to correct or improve it
to use machines or computers instead of people to do a particular task, especially in a factory or office
the fact of being certain to happen and unable to be avoided or prevented
to obey a rule or reach the necessary stated standard
a machine, usually with wheels and an engine, used for transporting people or goods, especially on land
the use of something in order to get an advantage from it
arranged to happen at a particular time
to go with someone or to be provided or exist at the same time as something
being or using the power produced when the nucleus of an atom is divided or joined to another nucleus; relating to weapons that use nuclear energy
the possibility that something good might happen in the future
to notice something that is partly hidden or not clear, or to discover something, especially using a special method
